name: wtf
description: The personal information dashboard for your terminal
readme_summary: WTF (wtfutil) is a terminal-based personal information dashboard designed to provide developers and tech professionals with at-a-glance access to important but infrequently needed stats and data. It offers a customizable TUI/CUI experience for monitoring various aspects of your digital life and workflow directly from your command line.
key_features: At-a-glance access to stats and data
primary_use_case: To serve as a centralized, customizable dashboard within the terminal for developers and tech users to monitor key information and statistics.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old owl wearing a pair of futuristic augmented reality glasses, perched on a branch made of glowing code. The owl is looking intently at a holographic display projected from its glasses, which shows a constellation of interconnected data points, charts, and system status icons. Around the owl, subtle digital particles representing information flow are visible. The background is a dark, starry night sky, with the repository name 'WTF' subtly integrated into the starry pattern. The overall style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear iconography and a slightly mystical, informative mood.

name: InnerTune
description: A Material 3 YouTube Music client for Android
readme_summary: InnerTune is an Android application that provides a Material 3-themed client for YouTube Music. It allows users to play music from YouTube Music without ads, with background playback, offline downloads, synchronized lyrics, and various audio customization options.
key_features: Search functionality for YouTube Music content
Audio customization (skip silence, normalization, tempo/pitch adjustment)
primary_use_case: To provide a feature-rich, ad-free, and customizable music listening experience for YouTube Music on Android devices, leveraging Material 3 design principles.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, modern Android phone screen displaying a vibrant music player interface. From the phone, a stream of musical notes and glowing data particles flows outwards, transforming into a lush, serene garden filled with diverse plants and flowers, symbolizing the curated and enhanced music experience. In the background, subtle icons representing YouTube Music and Material 3 design elements are visible. The overall mood is peaceful and enriching, with a clean, bright color palette. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with smooth gradients and soft lighting, clearly conveying the transformation of raw music into a delightful, organized experience.

name: my-blog
description: Blog project that heavily uses ChatGPT and Cursor. As a back-end enthusiast who’s no fan of CSS, I relied on these AI tools to help shape both the design and content. From styling advice to layout tweaks, the entire process was an AI-driven collaboration—and it turned out surprisingly well!
readme_summary: This repository provides a modern, responsive, and customizable blog platform built with Next.js 14 and TypeScript. It features a beautiful UI with light/dark mode, smooth animations, Markdown/MDX support, and a tag system, designed for easy content creation and deployment.
primary_use_case: To serve as a customizable and visually appealing personal blog platform with modern web technologies.
cover_image_prompt: A digital artist meticulously crafting a beautiful, illuminated manuscript on a sleek, modern desk. The manuscript is open, showing elegant text and vibrant illustrations, representing blog content. Around the desk, subtle elements like glowing code snippets, a palette with emerald and teal hues, and smooth, flowing lines suggest animation and design. A small, unobtrusive screen displays the repository name 'MinhBTC Blog' and a simple UI toggle for light/dark mode. The overall scene is clean, bright, and futuristic, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a focus on detail and a harmonious color scheme.

name: samarium
description: Open-source business management system with ERP, POS, invoicing, and CMS features. Laravel-based, Docker-ready. Still in active development.
readme_summary: Samarium is an open-source, Laravel-based business management system designed for small businesses. It offers integrated ERP, Point of Sale (POS), invoicing, customer management, and basic CMS features, all deployable via Docker.
primary_use_case: To provide small businesses with an integrated, self-hostable, and cost-effective solution for managing core operations like sales, finances, and customer relations.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, anthropomorphic toolbox labeled 'Samarium' stands open, revealing organized compartments. From one compartment, simple invoices and receipts neatly stack up. From another, a cash register drawer pops open, showing coins and receipts. A small customer profile card is visible in a third. The toolbox is placed on a clean desk next to a laptop displaying a simple dashboard with charts. Subtle glowing digital particles flow around the toolbox, connecting the different modules. The background is a soft, blurred office environment. The style is a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, bright color palette, emphasizing organization and ease of use.
